messages.message:
I’m seeing a bug when trying to remove a file from the Converse multidoc context.
In the recording I’m trying to remove the “728 LLC” doc and keep the “apple” one. But when I click `X` it removes the apple instead.
This is on https://aihub-sandbox.internal.instabase.com/
~Thanks for reporting! I'm able to reproduce this with 2 files. Taking a look~

Oh just realised this is an expected behaviour. This is because you have the 728 opened.

When there is only one file in scope, the scope behaves like single doc and will always have the currently opened document in scope. This is to avoid the synchronisation confusion where you are seeing a doc but the query is sent to another.
Removing the other doc is not expected though. If I click X on a doc A why would it remove doc B

I agree that it's confusing to see the file you removed not being removed here.

The solutions I can think of are:
1. Disabling the active file from getting removed
2. Removing the clicked file (which the user intended to remove) and automatically switching to the last file remaining one. After this it continues single doc scope behaviour.
